instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2 different kinda lcd connector
threads.message:
started to work on this water damaged board, the lcd cable and connector is burnt at that 3 pin where the main voltage goes to the lcd, i have some donor boards, thought i will replace the connector from there, but noticed the original cable would not fit, s original cable does, and what i can order the cheaper kinda lcd connector is not what i need, anyway i ordered the one is on the board now, but i was wondering, can i replace the lcd connector and a matching lcd cable, would that work fine? 
The lcd connector i need is like almost 20eur for 1 piece, and the other one (with a flat top part) is like 2eur/pc, i dont want to build a stock of the more expensive one.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2 different kinda lcd connector
threads.message: You can. Helps if you give the board number. I am guessing you mean the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> connector. The standard old style connector was used from 2008-2011. The new style was only used for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> from 2012, which was not a popular machine: most elected to purchase a retina rather than a classic that year. Since that connector was only used for a single year, on an unpopular model, it isn't worth stocking whichis what makes it so expensive from the very few vendors that supply it. Low demand. I've replaced less than 3 of them.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2 different kinda lcd connector
threads.message: If your LCD cable is also fried just replace both of them with 2011 cable/connector.
